* why sultan? * why t use subprocess? * reason use over ansible saltstack? * examples * example 1: getting started * example 2: sultan context management * example 3: compounding and (&&) or (||) * example 4: redirecting pipes (|) * example 5: redirecting output file * example 6: read standard input * example 7: running another user * example 8: running root * example 9: disable logging is sultan?¶sultan is python package interfacing command-line utilities, likeyum, apt-, or ls, a pythonic manner. lets run command-line utilities using simple function calls. simplest to sultan is just call :from sultan.api import sultans = sultan()s.sudo("yum install -y tree").run()runs:sudo yum install -y tree; recommended of using sultan is use in context management mode. here is to sultan context management: sultan.api import sultan sultan.load(sudo=true) s: s.yum("install -y tree").run()runs:sudo su - root -c 'yum install -y tree;' if want install command a remote machine? can easily achieve using context management: sultan.api import sultan sultan.load(sudo=true, hostname="myserver.com") sultan: sultan.yum("install -y tree").run()runs:ssh root@myserver.com 'sudo su - root -c 'yum install -y tree;'' you enter wrong command, sultan print details need debug find problem quickly.here, same command was run a mac: sultan.api import sultan sultan.load(sudo=true, hostname="myserver.com") sultan: sultan.yum("install -y tree").run()yields:[sultan]: sudo su - root -c 'yum install -y tree;'password:[sultan]: --{ stderr }-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[sultan]: | -sh: yum: command found[sultan]: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- to started?
